titleStmt.title: An elegie on the never to be forgotten Sir Thomas Armstrong Knight; executed for conspiring the death of his most sacred Majesty, and royal brother, June 20. 1684. With some satyrical reflections on the whole faction.

publicationStmt.publisher: Re-printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to his most sacred Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Text printed in two columns within black mourning borders.
Imperfect: blurred print with slight loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
